snippet.title: A Day Out in Chicago's Lincoln Park
snippet.description: Lincoln Park is one of Chicago's better-known neighborhoods and a favorite hangout for some of the best, free, family entertainment in the city.

snippet.title: Chicago, Illinois | Get Blown Away by the Windy City
snippet.description: From planetarium views and the city's own dazzling skyline to Sue the T. Rex and that famous deep-dish pizza, Chi-Town is world-class.

snippet.title: Tall Buildings of Chicago Activity Page
snippet.description: This city is home to some of the tallest buildings in the world. Have the kids bring this activity sheet with them and see if they can spot the buildings featured.

snippet.title: Chicago Travel Map
snippet.description: Kids can explore the great landmarks of this Midwestern metropolis.

snippet.title: Chicago History Museum
snippet.description: What's so special about a Chicago hot dog? Did a cow really start the Great Chicago Fire? What was Chicago like before it was a big city? At the recently...

snippet.title: Uno Chicago Grill
snippet.description: Uno Chicago Grill (formerly known as Pizzeria Uno) is credited as the birthplace of Chicago-style deep-dish pizza, which is thicker and gooier than traditional deep dish. Since opening...

snippet.title: Chicago Children's Museum
snippet.description: Located near the front of Navy Pier in the Family Pavilion, the Chicago Children's Museum features 15 permanent exhibits, plus rotating exhibits, all of which are more than enough to...

snippet.title: Chicago ChildrenÂ’s Theatre
snippet.description: The new-ish Chicago Children's Theatre (it mounted its first performance in 2006) stages lavish Broadway-style productions for kids ages 5 and up, though at $12-$30 for tickets...

snippet.title: Art Institute of Chicago
snippet.description: If you think an art museum sounds like it would be too stuffy for kids, think again. Yes, the Art Institute of Chicago houses one of the most impressive collections...

snippet.title: DVD Review: Thirteen Days
snippet.description: An outstanding movie for families with older kids.
